docs.name: Colombia: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total
docs.description:
Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private upper secondary education institutions (ISCED 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.
Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total

docs.name: Colombia: Bank teller is main mode of deposit into account, secondary education or more (% with an account,  age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults whose usual mode of access to get cash (paper or coins) from their account(s) is over the counter in a branch of one's bank or financial institution (% with a secondary education or more, age 15+, with a formal account)
Bank teller is main mode of deposit into account, secondary education or more (% with an account,  age 15+)

docs.name: Colombia: ATM is main mode of deposit into account, female (% with an account,  age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults whose usual mode of access to get cash (paper or coins) from their account(s) is an ATM (% female, age 15+, with a formal account)
ATM is main mode of deposit into account, female (% with an account,  age 15+)

docs.name: Colombia: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare
docs.description:
Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in health and welfare programmes.
Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare

docs.name: Colombia: School life expectancy (years).  Primary to secondary.  Female
docs.description:
School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Female is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.
School life expectancy (years).  Primary to secondary.  Female

docs.name: Colombia: Gross outbound enrolment ratio. Tertiary
docs.description:
Gross outbound enrolment ratio. Tertiary is the total number of mobile tertiary students coming from a country/region as a percentage of the population of tertiary student age in their home country.
Gross outbound enrolment ratio. Tertiary

docs.name: Colombia: Internally displaced persons (number, high estimate)
docs.description:
Internally displaced persons are people or groups of people who have been forced or obliged to flee or to leave their homes or places of habitual residence, in particular as a result of armed conflict, or to avoid the effects of armed conflict, situations of generalized violence, violations of human rights, or natural or human-made disasters and who have not crossed an international border.
Internally displaced persons (number, high estimate)

docs.name: Colombia: 3+ withdrawals from account in a typical month, older adults (% with an account,  age 25+)
docs.description:
Adults who make 3 or more withdrawals from their personal account(s) in a typical month. This includes cash or electronic deposits, or any  time money is put into account(s) by self or others (% age 25+, with a formal account)
3+ withdrawals from account in a typical month, older adults (% with an account,  age 25+)

docs.name: Colombia: Pupil-teacher ratio.  Upper secondary
docs.description:
Pupil-teacher ratio. Upper secondary is the number of pupils enrolled in upper secondary school divided by the number of upper secondary school teachers.
Pupil-teacher ratio.  Upper secondary

docs.name: Colombia: Voice and Accountability: Number of Sources
docs.description:
Voice and Accountability captures perceptions of the extent to which a country's citizens are able to participate in selecting their government, as well as freedom of expression, freedom of association, and a free media.
Voice and Accountability: Number of Sources

docs.name: Colombia: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total
docs.description:
Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100. 
Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total

docs.name: Colombia: Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary. Total
docs.description:
Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary social sciences, business and law programs.
Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary. Total

docs.name: Colombia: Debit card, rural (% age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults with a debit card (% living in an urban area, age 15+ )
Debit card, rural (% age 15+)

docs.name: Colombia: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female
docs.description:
Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female is the total number of female students enrolled at public and private 5A tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5A tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are largely theoretically based and are intended to provide sufficient qualifications for gaining entry into advanced research programmes and profession with high skills requirements.
Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female

docs.name: Colombia: Bank teller is main mode of withdrawal from account, income quintiles I (lowest) and II (% with an account,  age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults whose usual mode of access to put cash (paper or coins) into their account(s) is over the counter in a branch of one's bank or financial institution (% in the first (lowest) and second income quintiles (0-40th percentile), age 15+, with a formal account)
Bank teller is main mode of withdrawal from account, income quintiles I (lowest) and II (% with an account,  age 15+)

docs.name: Colombia: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Female
docs.description:
Repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year. 
Repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Female

docs.name: Colombia: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 5. Total
docs.description:
Enrolment in secondary. Grade 5. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 5 of secondary education.
Enrolment in secondary. Grade 5. Total

docs.name: Colombia: Pupil-teacher ratio.  Lower secondary
docs.description:
Pupil-teacher ratio. Lower secondary is the number of pupils enrolled in lower secondary school divided by the number of lower secondary school teachers.
Pupil-teacher ratio.  Lower secondary

docs.name: Colombia: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. General programmes. Total
docs.description:
Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. General programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in general programmes at public lower secondary education institutions.
Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. General programmes. Total

docs.name: Colombia: ATM is main mode of deposit into account, rural (% with an account,  age 15+)
docs.description:
Adults whose usual mode of access to get cash (paper or coins) from their account(s) is an ATM (% living in an urban area, age 15+ , with a formal account)
